Горад-Дзяржава Занзібар|Горада-Дзяржавы Занзібара|Городу-Дзяржаве Занзібару|Горад-Дзяржаву Занзібар|Горадам-Дзяржавай Занзібарам|Горадзе-Дзяржаве Занзібаре
Rainforest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts, and grant +1 Appeal to adjacent tiles, instead of the usual -1.

[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide 60% of civics and technologies instead of 50%. When completing a wonder receive a random [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration from the era of the wonder, if available.
Train Builders in half the usual time.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.

Each Archaeological Museum holds 6 [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts instead of 3, and can support 2 Archaeologists at once. Archaeological Museums are automatically themed when they have 6 [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts.
Receive a second light cavalry unit or Saka Horse Archer each time you train a light cavalry unit or Saka Horse Archer.
When you capture a Barbarian Outpost, receive a Tribal Village reward in addition to the usual [ICON_Gold] Gold. Pay half the usual cost to levy city-state units.
+15% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and wonders if placed next to a River. Floodplains do not block placement of districts and wonders.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.
Extra territory upon founding cities. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra.

Automatically receive the final [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (if you have not earned a [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet already). +1 [ICON_Science] Science for each foreign city following Arabia's Religion.

+2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, and Sculpture [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art in addition to the usual [ICON_Culture] Culture. Receive 50% more [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points. Palace has slots for 5 Great Works.

May form Fleets and Armadas with Mercantilism, instead of Nationalism and Mobilization. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes receive +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between multiple continents receive triple these numbers. Cities not on your original Capital’s continent receive +25% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and a builder when founded.
Earn all government legacy bonuses in half the usual time.
Receives Follower Belief bonuses in a city from each Religion that has at least 1 follower.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Medieval, Renaissance, and Industrial era wonders. [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from wonders of any era is +100%.
Each city can build one more district than usual (exceeding the normal limit based on [ICON_Citizen] Population).

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. If in [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range of your [ICON_Capital] Capital, they also start with a road to it. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities.

Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology. Naval melee units heal in neutral territory. Units ignore additional [ICON_Movement] Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.
Roughly 3.8 million square miles (9.6 million square kilometers)
Under Umayyad Caliphate, Est. 5.79 million square miles (15 million square km)
Some 3.29 million square miles (8.5 million square km)
Various (Salvador, Rio de Janeiro, currently Brasilia)
Est. 3.7 million square miles (9.6 million square km)
Many (the four primary ones: Nanjing, Luoyang, Chang'an, and currently Beijing)
Roughly 94 thousand square miles (243458.88 square km)
Est. 390 thousand square miles (1 million square km)
Various (Memphis, Thebes, Alexandria, and currently Cairo)
Est. 246.2 thousand square miles (640.6 thousand square km)
Various (Orleans, Tours, Versailles, Vichy, mostly Paris)
Est. 390 thousand square miles ( 1 million square km in 1050 AD)
Roughly (very) 50.9 thousand square miles (131.9 thousand square km)
All of the cities, but primarily Sparta and Athens, and currently Athens
Est. 1.3 million square miles (3.3 million square km)
Est. 146 thousand square miles (378 thousand square km)
Various (too numerous to list until Kyoto; currently Tokyo)
At greatest extent, 49.9 thousand square miles (129.4 thousand square km)
Est. 148.7 thousand square miles (385.2 thousand square km)
Europe (and Asia Minor, Africa, Middle East and other bits)
Some 2.5 million square miles (6.5 million square km) under Trajan
Europe-Asia (and briefly a piece of North America)
Some 8.4 million square miles (21.8 million square km)
Roughly 384 thousand square miles (994 thousand square km)
Unknown, best guess is 40-50 thousand at peak
None (the only city mentioned in the histories is "Scythian Neapolis," destroyed by the Goths in 3rd Century AD)
Est. 195 thousand square miles (504.4 thousand square km)
Many (Lagash, Eridu, Uruk, Kish, Ur, or wherever the current king hailed from)
Egyptian unique unit: Maryannu Chariot Archer
Scythian unique unit: Saka Horse Archer
English unique district: Royal Navy Dockyard
